title: Hal Finney Envisions Crypto Trading Cards
description: On January 17 1993 Hal Finney shared his vision

title: Herbert R. Sim’s Satoshi Samurai Drawing
description: On April 27 2010 Herbert R. Sim published one of the first portraits of Bitcoin’s creator as a Samurai

title: Launch of .bit Domains
description: On April 21 2011 the .bit Domains were launched on NameCoin as early non-fungible digital assets

title: First Punycode Domains
description: On May 10 2011 creative domain names were experimented with using Punycode on NameCoin

title: First ASCII Tribute on Bitcoin Blockchain
description: On July 30 2011 Dan Kaminsky embedded the first ASCII tribute honoring cryptographer Len Sassaman

title: Launch of Casascius Coins
description: On October 26 2011 Mike Caldwell began issuing Casascius Coins—physical Bitcoins with authenticity features

title: Proposal of Coloured Coins
description: On March 28 2012 Yoni Assia introduced Coloured Coins

title: First NameCoin Identities
description: On May 31 2012 decentralized identities were created on NameCoin

title: Kevin Abosch Releases Bank
description: On January 16 2013 Kevin Abosch released his conceptual book “Bank” featuring paired Bitcoin keys

title: Bitcoin Roller Coaster Comic
description: On April 14 2013 Brainless Tales posted the iconic Bitcoin Roller Coaster comic on Reddit

title: Launch of Cryptographics
description: On July 28 2013 Cryptographics launched

title: Untitled Mining Installation
description: On August 21 2013 Peter Frölich created an artwork featuring a working Bitcoin mining rig in an antique frame

title: 200 Bitcoin Painting by Kuno Goda
description: On September 14 2013 Kuno Goda created a 200 Bitcoin Painting that made international headlines

title: Launch of the Huntercoin Game
description: On February 1 2014 the Huntercoin decentralized game and currency was launched

title: Computers and Capital Group Exhibition
description: On February 15 2014 the group exhibition “Computers and Capital: The Rise of Digital Currency” was held at Coinfest in Vancouver

title: Free Lunch by Dave Young Kim
description: On March 6 2014 Dave Young Kim created “Free Lunch”

title: Bitcoin Art Fair & Meetup
description: On March 6 2014 the Bitcoin Art Fair & Meetup was held during San Francisco’s Bitcoin meetup

title: Cryptograffiti’s Street Art
description: On March 13 2014 Cryptograffiti’s street art promoted Bitcoin using guerrilla marketing

title: Bitcoin-themed Stamps by Pierre Bourque
description: On March 14 2014 Pierre Bourque initiated Bitcoin-themed stamps

title: Newsweek Bitcoin’s Face
description: On March 16 2014 Ben Wiseman created the iconic Newsweek cover featuring Dorian Nakamoto

title: Proof of Work Exhibition
description: On April 24 2014 the “Proof of Work” group exhibition was held in San Francisco

title: Official Launch of Monegraph
description: On May 3 2014 Monegraph

title: Seven on Seven Conference
description: On May 3 2014 the Seven on Seven Conference at New Museum saw the creation of the first digital art token

title: Launch of LazyCoin
description: On May 14 2014 the conceptual currency LazyCoin was launched as a “proof of non-work” currency

title: Nakamoto (The Proof)
description: On May 28 2014 Émilie Brout and Maxime Marion presented “Nakamoto (The Proof)” using a scanned copy of Satoshi Nakamoto’s passport

title: Solo Exhibition: Monetary Series
description: On May 29 2014 Jenna Lash held a solo exhibition titled “Monetary Series” at Bitcoin Center NYC

title: Launch of Cointemporary Bitcoin Art Gallery
description: On June 1 2014 Cointemporary Bitcoin Art Gallery was launched to showcase Bitcoin art

title: TatianaCoin Launch
description: On June 3 2014 Tatiana Moroz launched TatianaCoin on the CounterParty blockchain

title: Tokenization of the OLGA NFT
description: On June 12 2014 JP Janssen tokenized a sketch on the CounterParty blockchain

title: Last (Bitcoin) Supper by Youl
description: On July 21 2014 Youl created “Last (Bitcoin) Supper”

title: This Contract is Art by Rhea Myers
description: On July 22 2014 Rhea Myers created “This Contract is Art”

title: Ethereum Art Market Launch
description: On July 24 2014 Rhea Myers launched the first Ethereum art market smart contract

title: Tokenization of TwitterEggs
description: On July 27 2014 tokenization of TwitterEggs began on NameCoin using the OneCoin dApp

title: NILIcoins NFT Art Project
description: On September 14 2014 Nili Lerner announced her NILIcoins NFT art project

title: BearWhale by Billy Mabrey
description: On October 7 2014 Billy Mabrey created BearWhale depicting a trading chart and the first BearWhale

title: The Darknet Group Exhibition
description: On October 18 2014 the exhibition “The Darknet – From Memes to Onionland” was held at Kunst Halle Sankt Gallen

title: Eye Of God by Xania Dorfman
description: On October 27 2014 Xania Dorfman’s “Eye Of God” sold at a conference in Israel

title: The Slaying of BearWhale by Christopher Steininger
description: On November 3 2014 Christopher Steininger created “The Slaying of BearWhale” commemorating a historic sale

title: The Slaying of BearWhale by Matt Habel
description: On November 3 2014 Matt Habel created “The Slaying of BearWhale” after winning a commemorative competition

title: MYSOUL by Rhea Myers
description: On November 21 2014 Rhea Myers tokenized her soul as MYSOUL on the DogeCoin and CounterParty blockchain

title: Sarah Meyohas launches BitchCoin
description: On February 15 2015 Sarah Meyohas launched BitchCoin

title: First Issued FDCARD
description: On March 11 2015 the first digital trading cards (FDCARD) were issued on the CounterParty blockchain

title: Official Launch of Scarab Experiment
description: On March 16 2015 the Scarab Experiment

title: Bitcoin Puzzle Painting by Coin Artist
description: On April 9 2015 Coin Artist Marguerite deCourcelle released a puzzle painting with a 4.87 BTC reward

title: MAK Vienna Digital Artwork Purchase
description: On April 24 2015 MAK Vienna became the first art museum to purchase digital artwork with Bitcoin

title: Launch of Verisart
description: On July 7 2015 Verisart was launched to create digital certificates for art and collectibles

title: First Spore of Plantoid by Primavera De Filippi
description: On July 17 2015 Primavera De Filippi created the first spore of her blockchain-based Plantoid

title: The Human Face of Cryptoeconomies Exhibition
description: On October 17 2015 Furtherfield Gallery hosted “The Human Face of Cryptoeconomies” exhibition

title: Launch of Ξtheria Decentralized Virtual World
description: On October 31 2015 the Ξtheria decentralized virtual world was launched at Devcon1 in London

title: Cryptograffiti Raises Bitcoin for Dorian Nakamoto
description: On November 12 2015 Cryptograffiti raised 17.3 Bitcoin for Dorian Nakamoto

title: Random Darknet Shopper by !Mediengruppe Bitnik
description: On December 11 2015 the “Random Darknet Shopper” showcased a shopping bot using Bitcoin

title: Launch of the Left Gallery Marketplace
description: On December 15 2015 Left Gallery Marketplace was launched as a digital art gallery on Ascribe

title: HODL by Cryptograffiti
description: On February 11 2016 Cryptograffiti created HODL prints and sculptures inspired by pop art

title: Furtherfield Showcase: Art and the Blockchain
description: On March 28 2016 Furtherfield Showcase curated by Ruth Catlow was exhibited at the Digital Catapult

title: Physical Bitcoin and Crypto Encyclopedia
description: On April 15 2016 Elias Ahonen published the first physical encyclopedia cataloging Bitcoin and crypto collectibles

title: Proof Of Art – The Bitcoin Art Show
description: On May 25 2016 the “Proof Of Art – The Bitcoin Art Show” group exhibition was hosted by Cryptograffiti

title: Release of Bittercoin – the Worst Miner Ever
description: On September 8 2016 Bittercoin was released after hacking an old calculator to create a Bitcoin miner

title: First Rare Pepes
description: On September 9 2016 the first Rare Pepes

title: Launch of Rare Pepe Wallet and Marketplace
description: On September 14 2016 Rare Pepe Wallet and Marketplace was launched for collecting and exchanging Rare Pepes

title: Launch of Book of Orbs Marketplace
description: On October 12 2016 the Book of Orbs Marketplace was launched as a CounterParty exchange for game items

title: DJPEPE Rare Pepe First Audio NFT
description: On October 16 2016 DJPEPE released the first Rare Pepe NFT that unlocks audio content

title: The Revolution Will Not Be Centralized Exhibition
description: On November 4 2016 Cryptograffiti held his solo exhibition “The Revolution Will Not Be Centralized” in San Francisco

title: Launch of Pixel Maps
description: On November 18 2016 the Pixel Maps project featuring 3

title: Launch of the Age Of Chains Trading Card Game
description: On November 25 2016 the Age Of Chains digital trading card game was launched on the CounterParty blockchain

title: Hammer Projects: Simon Denny Solo Exhibition
description: On January 21 2017 Simon Denny’s solo exhibition “Hammer Projects” was held at the Hammer Museum

title: First Episode of AOTB Art On The Blockchain Podcast
description: On March 18 2017 the first episode of the AOTB Art On The Blockchain Podcast aired

title: Launch of CounterParty-based Memorychain
description: On April 8 2017 Memorychain

title: Official Launch of Spells of Genesis
description: On April 20 2017 the digital card game Spells of Genesis was officially launched
